media:group.media:title: SIGGRAPH Asia 2022 – Technical Papers Trailer
media:group.media:description:
Preview the SIGGRAPH Asia 2022 Technical Papers program!
The SIGGRAPH Asia Technical Papers program is the premier international forum for disseminating new scholarly work in computer graphics and interactive techniques. Technical Papers are published as a special issue of ACM Transactions on Graphics.
For more information on the 155 specially curated Technical Papers which will be presented in-person in Daegu. Find out more here: https://sa2022.siggraph.org/en/attend/technical-papers/
Join us at the event to discover and learn more! Register here: https://bit.ly/sa22reg
#SIGGRAPHAsia #SIGGRAPHAsia2022 #SAtechpapers

media:group.media:title: SIGGRAPH 2022 Real-Time Live!
media:group.media:description:
Watch a recording of this electrifying SIGGRAPH showcase celebrating the top original, jury-reviewed interactive projects of the year. See the latest in real-time technology from the premier conference on computer graphics and interactive techniques.
#SIGGRAPH2022 #RealTimeLive #RTL #SIGGRAPH

entry.title: SIGGRAPH Now: SIGGRAPH 2022 Electronic Theater Director’s Panel Webinar

media:group.media:title: SIGGRAPH Now: SIGGRAPH 2022 Electronic Theater Director’s Panel Webinar
media:group.media:description:
A special SIGGRAPH Now feature, in this webinar we present a discussion with the SIGGRAPH 2022 Electronic Theater Best in Show winner "The Seine's Tears" (Eliott Benard and Belaid Yanis), Best Student Project winner "Yallah!" (Nayla Nassar), and Jury’s Choice winner "The End of War" (Lei Chen). SIGGRAPH 2023 Electronic Theater Director Kalina Borkiewicz moderates this thrilling discussion with some of the year's top animation storytellers.
Check out our SIGGRAPH Now playlist for more computer graphics insights: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLUPhVMQuDB_ZeOSy0uhlmVgcETB_Prf1I
#SIGGRAPH2022 #SIGGRAPHNow #ElectronicTheater #SIGGRAPHcaf

entry.title: Register for SIGGRAPH Asia 2022 | 6 - 9 December 2022 in Daegu, South Korea

media:group.media:title: Register for SIGGRAPH Asia 2022 | 6 - 9 December 2022 in Daegu, South Korea
media:group.media:description:
Join over 6,000 Computer Graphics & Interactive Techniques professionals in Daegu, South Korea this December. Check out the refreshed registration categories here: https://bit.ly/sa22reg
With South Korea further opening her borders, this is the best time to start planning your year-end vacation to coincide with the event. From scenic nature trails, sports adventures, cultural experiences to dazzling marketplaces – There is something for everyone in your family.
Learn, network, and get inspired by some of the brightest minds in the Computer Graphics industry. Click here for the full program: https://sa2022.siggraph.org/en/full-program/ (More sessions and content will be added onto this schedule in the coming weeks)
For more details, visit our website at https://sa2022.siggraph.org
#SIGGRAPHAsia #SIGGRAPHAsia2022 #ComputerGraphics #InteractiveTechniques

entry.title: SIGGRAPH Now: Immersive Pavilion: Mixed Reality Collaboration for Complementary Working Styles

media:group.media:title: SIGGRAPH Now: Immersive Pavilion: Mixed Reality Collaboration for Complementary Working Styles
media:group.media:description:
ORIGINALLY PRESENTED AS PART OF SIGGRAPH 2022
Join the team behind SIGGRAPH 2022 Immersive Pavilion selection “Mixed Reality Collaboration for Complementary Working Styles” for an in-depth panel discussion led by Immersive Pavilion Chair Derek Ham. The team from NYU Future Reality Lab / Courant Institute shares a behind-the-scenes look at their project that combines immersive VR, multitouch AR, real-time volumetric capture, robotically actuated tangible interfaces at multiple scales, spatial audio, and live coding in service of a human-centric way of collaborating.
Check out our SIGGRAPH Now playlist for more computer graphics insights: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list...
#SIGGRAPH2022 #SIGGRAPHNow #ImmersivePavilion #VR

entry.title: SIGGRAPH Now: Building the Metaverse: An Expert Discussion

media:group.media:title: SIGGRAPH Now: Building the Metaverse: An Expert Discussion
media:group.media:description:
ORIGINALLY PRESENTED AS PART OF SIGGRAPH 2022
BUILDING THE METAVERSE: AN EXPERT DISCUSSION Are we still in the early adopter stage of the metaverse? What have recent events taught us about where this tech is going?
SIGGRAPH 2022 presents a discussion with Cathy Hackl (Futures Intelligence Group) and Dan Burgar (Frontier Collection) in which we’ll cover all things metaverse and its looming presence in computer graphics and interactive techniques. Watch now for a moderated panel to expand your view of the metaverse and its potential.
Check out our SIGGRAPH Now playlist for more computer graphics insights: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLUPhVMQuDB_ZeOSy0uhlmVgcETB_Prf1I
#SIGGRAPH2022 #SIGGRAPHNow #Metaverse

media:group.media:title: SIGGRAPH 2022 VR Theater Recap
media:group.media:description:
Feel the SIGGRAPH 2022 VR Theater vibes in this recap of the in person experience in Vancouver.
Learn more about the program and get excited to see more incredible work like this at future SIGGRAPH conferences. https://s2022.siggraph.org/program/vr-theater/
#SIGGRAPH2022 #VRTheater #VR

media:group.media:title: SIGGRAPH 2022 Highlights #2
media:group.media:description:
Enjoy highlights from the SIGGRAPH live week in Vancouver! We are thrilled to welcome our global computer graphics community to our first-ever hybrid conference experience. https://s2022.siggraph.org

media:group.media:title: SIGGRAPH 2022 Conference Overview
media:group.media:description:
SIGGRAPH is celebrating 49 years of advancements in computer graphics and interactive techniques. As an exchange of knowledge, a source of entertainment, and an opportunity for recognition, SIGGRAPH 2022 continues to serve our community as an open, welcoming forum to proudly share passions and celebrate contributions.
This year in our in person and virtual conference experiences, we feature breakthroughs in research and technology, speakers who will inspire and push the field forward, and a community that will collaborate and enjoy all that has been achieved and what is now possible.
Join us in person in Vancouver 8-11 August and in our virtual conference platform now through 31 October. https://s2022.siggraph.org/
Appy Hour: Arithmagical https://s2022.siggraph.org/presentation/?id=appy_101&sess=sess207
Art Gallery: RAY https://s2022.siggraph.org/presentation/?id=artg_153&sess=sess224

Emerging Technologies: Rapid Design of Articulated Objects: An Interactive Showcase https://s2022.siggraph.org/presentation/?id=gensubcur_110&sess=sess221
Frontiers: Haptics: A Touch of the Metaverse https://s2022.siggraph.org/presentation/?id=front_102&sess=sess308
Games: AI and Physics Assisted Character Pose Authoring https://s2022.siggraph.org/presentation/?id=real_108&sess=sess205
Immersive Pavilion: Journal of My Journey: Seamless Interaction in Virtuality and Reality With Digital Fabrication and Sensory Feedback https://s2022.siggraph.org/presentation/?id=gensub_201&sess=sess228
Labs: Hands-on Exploration of Hybrid 4D Printing Design Space https://s2022.siggraph.org/presentation/?id=gensub_373&sess=sess268
Panels: Privacy, Safety, and Wellbeing: Solutions for the Future of AR and VR https://s2022.siggraph.org/presentation/?id=gensub_150&sess=sess151
Posters: Synchronized Hand Difference Visualization for Piano Learning https://s2022.siggraph.org/presentation/?id=pos_110&sess=sess240
Production Sessions: Using Scientific Data to Show Climate Change in "Atlas of a Changing Earth" https://s2022.siggraph.org/presentation/?id=pros_109&sess=sess265
Real-Time Live!: FUTURE.STAGE by Evil Eye Pictures & Patrick Osborne https://s2022.siggraph.org/presentation/?id=real_132&sess=sess205
Retrospective: Computer Graphics Disruptions in Art, Science, Visualization, Engineering and Modeling https://s2022.siggraph.org/presentation/?id=retro_103&sess=sess321
Talks: A Fast Solution for Cubic and Higher-order Polynomials https://s2022.siggraph.org/presentation/?id=gensub_298&sess=sess165

#SIGGRAPH2022 #ComputerGraphics #SIGGRAPH #InteractiveTechniques

media:group.media:title: SIGGRAPH 2022 VR Theater Preview
media:group.media:description:
Immerse yourself in the future of computer graphics and interactive techniques in the SIGGRAPH 2022 VR Theater.
The SIGGRAPH VR Theater is an immersive storytelling showcase celebrating the evolution of VR with a selection of short-form narratives in an in-person theater setting. The main program is a showcase of the best VR narrative content experienced in a high-end, seated, panoramic, multi-viewer immersive space, running approximately one hour from start to finish.
For detailed information and a complete listing of VR Theater content, visit https://s2022.siggraph.org/program/vr-theater/
Credits: VR Theater Director: Yangos Hadjiyannis Editor: Carlos Tejeda Graphic Animation: Eveline Falcão
#SIGGRAPH2022 #VRTheater #VR

entry.title: SIGGRAPH Now Webinar Series: Introduction to Machine Learning & Neural Networks - Part 3

media:group.media:title: SIGGRAPH Now Webinar Series: Introduction to Machine Learning & Neural Networks - Part 3
media:group.media:description:
Brought to you by SIGGRAPH University, this three-part webinar series will teach you all about machine learning and neural networks. Rajesh Sharma (VP of Engineering, Spire Animation Studios) has designed three intermediate-level workshops for attendees to gain a strong understanding of the basic principles of machine learning and neural networks. Using a mix of theory and hands-on practice Rajesh will help you build intuition around several topics with easy to understand explanations and examples from some of the most commonly used algorithms and models including Autoencoders, CNN, GAN, and Transformers. Brought to you by SIGGRAPH University.
Webinar Session Part 3 Course Files: https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1bRJXfr-mWdSqnJtuaTr8aTIevxZTzk8M?usp=sharing
Visit our website to learn more about upcoming SIGGRAPH Now educational opportunities: https://s2022.siggraph.org/siggraph-now-supplemental-learning/
#SIGGRAPHNow #SIGGRAPHUniversity #ML #NeuralNetworks #RajeshSharma

media:group.media:title: SIGGRAPH 2022 Real-Time Live! Preview
media:group.media:description:
Celebrate the SIGGRAPH 2022 Real-Time Live! program, the most exciting event of the year for real-time rendering, back in person again after two years in a virtual format. This live event showcases an electrifying sample of the latest and most advanced interactive projects in real-time. Plus, don’t miss a live pre-show from Promethean AI, building a game level in just a few minutes live on stage.
For detailed information and a complete listing of Real-Time Live! content, visit https://s2022.siggraph.org/program/real-time-live/
Credits: Real-Time Live! Chair: Yibing Jiang Real-Time Live! Subcommittee: Gracie Arenas Strittmatter, Andrew Maximov, Marc Olano, Cem Yuksel Real-Time Live! Administration: Brenda Drier, Jenna Feldman Real-Time Live! Jury: Yosun Chang, Inigo Quilez, Jeremy Cowles, Angela Luo, Ryan Trowbridge, Cem Yuksel Freeman AV Team: Bryan Naegele, John Kennedy GraphicsNet: Joe Cychosz Graphic Animation: Eveline Falcão
#SIGGRAPH2022 #RealTimeLive #RealTime
